headline: General Motors (NYSE:GM) Increases Dividend and Reports Stronger EPS Despite Lower Net Income
summary: General Motors (NYSE:GM) announced a quarterly cash dividend increase and reported positive earnings growth in revenue and EPS, despite a decline in net income for Q1 2025. Over the last week, GM's stock price moved 6% amid broader market gains, which rose 7% over the same period. The company's announcement added weight to the upward market trend as investors digested earnings reports from various companies. headline: GM pulls guidance as Trump is expected to scale back auto tariffs
summary: General Motors (GM) withdrew its full-year outlook with the American automaker's CFO Paul Jacobson stating, "The future impact of tariffs could be significant." TD Cowen equity analyst Itay Michaeli joins Catalysts host Madison Mills and Explosive Options technical analyst Bob Lang to take a closer look at GM's first quarter earnings print and discuss auto tariff relief measures that US President Trump is expected to announce later on Tuesday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: General Motors: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: DETROIT (AP) — General Motors Company (GM) on Tuesday reported first-quarter profit of $2.78 billion. The Detroit-based company said it had net income of $3.35 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring gains and pretax gains, came to $2.78 per share.

headline: General Motors (NYSE:GM) Surprises With Q1 Sales
summary: Automotive manufacturer General Motors (NYSE:GM) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales up 2.3% year on year to $44.02 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.78 per share was 4.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
